comment: Dr. Shahriar is a professor who breaks down a complex workflow so that anyone can understand. In addition to his excellent teaching style, he is accessible via appointment and office hours to assist his students.

Very caring professor for the students!  He will help you with anything and it helps if you take it in class because there are just a limited number of questions that can be asked from email rather than in class.  Especially a programming class. Just listen, pay attention to the examples presented in class and you'll find no problem with any of it.

Prof. Shahriar is a genuinely professional person.  1. He always respond to emails. 2. All his tests and assignments are from lectures or references provided by him. (Some tests and assignments were tricky, but its a very good learning. I am glad I opted his subject.)
lectures are easy to follow, grading is fair. gives brief lecture on topics needed to complete lab or assignment.
Took a hybrid section of CS2302 course. The labs are well paced. The instructor provides enough background information to start up the work. The deadlines are flexible too. Highly recommend.

He is a very smart person, you can tell by his lectures in class. He dedicates a lot of time to lab work, which mainly helped drive retention of the slides we went over in class. He makes sure to keep the class fully informed of any changes to the schedule and class meetings.

Prof. Shahria cares that his students understand the material he's teaching. He also allows for students to extensive research  outside of class, (helps you learn more than what lectures encompass, it is CS after all). He's very generous with grades in the sense that he provides the student enough chances to get a good grade. Highly recommend him!

He is very helpful and very very very generous on grade.. He allows you to retake two quizzes and a test..(take home//out of 6 quizzes and 3 tests.) His lecture is not very clear time to time, but he is very responsive to your email and very easy to contact. You can always ask questions individually after classes.

If you want to have good grade, please be present in his class and read/skim chapters before you attend lectures. He usually gives question from topics covered in classes. He gives lots of marks even if you answer incorrectly or submit incomplete homework. He allows retaking quizzes and extra time for assignments, which is helpful.

Dr.Shahriar is overall a nice and effective professor. He gladly accomodated some of assignments and quizzes that I missed. His reminder emails and announcements in GAView are helpful to catch up any missing hw, quiz, and exam. The only downside is the lack of slide usage and relying on board examples. Still his examples are easy to understand.

He goes extremely fast. The text book is used to do practices, but he does not follow it even a little. If you read the book, you will literally have to do a chapter per week to keep up, and half of the stuff you read you will never do in class. Not to bad of a teacher, but his lesson plan needs to be revamped.
